720495f-c.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Vestry Street
720495f-c.text:
189 to 195 and 205 to 211 Hudson Street, west side, north from but not
including Vestry, across Desbrosses, to and including Canal Streets. The
4-story structure (No. 195) at the S.W. corner of Desbrosses Street is on
the site of the Leonard Lispenard House where Washington was entertained
in 1775. On the opposite corner (N.W.) are two 27-story frame house with
brick fronts. This is a set of three views; No. two showing the lower
stories of Nos. 189 to 193; No. three, Nos. 191 and 193; the latter two
being between Vestry and Desbrosses Street.
December 1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
720495f-c.folder: Hudson Street & Vestry Street, Manhattan, NY

720493f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Vestry Street
720493f-a.text:
182 to 192 Hudson Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner
of Vestry Street. Nos. 188, 190, and 192 are frame houses with brick
fronts. These buildings were later demolished and on their site was
erected the 12-story Green Terminal Building. Also shown are tracks
and cars of the New York Central Railroad.
About 1900.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720493f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Vestry Street, Manhattan, NY

189 to 195 and 205 to 211 Hudson Street, west side, north from but not

720495f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Vestry Street, Manhattan, NY

720492f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Vestry Street
720492f-a.text:
182 to 186 Hudson Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner
of Vestry Street. Also shown (right) are Nos. 24 to 18 and 16-12 Vestry
Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Hudson Street. Nos. 24
to 18 are a row of 27-story frame houses with brick fronts. These dwellings
were demolished and is now (1937) a portion of the site of the Green
Terminal Building.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
720492f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Vestry Street, Manhattan, NY

720494f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Vestry Street
720494f-a.text:
184 to 204 Hudson Street, east side, north from but not including
Vestry, to and including Canal Streets. Nos. 188 to 198 (six houses
beginning with the 3-story white one on the right) are frame houses with
brick fronts. All the buildings were rased in approximately 1928, and
on their site was erected the Green Terminal Building, a 12-story structure.
The tracks seen are those of the New York Central Railroad.
Prior to 1930.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
720494f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Vestry Street, Manhattan, NY

720489f-b.text:
View 1, and 2.
Nodson Street, east side northeast corner
between Vestry and hights Streets,
looking north.
P.L.Speer.
NO REPRODUCTION. August 15, 1939.

720490f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Vestry Street
720490f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, north from Vestry Street. Also shown is a
sentry box, used by the flagman of the New York Central Railroad at the
S.E. corner of Vestry Street.
December 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
